nasha_components_partition_zfs_options_a: Disables the need for the kernel to update file access time every time it's requested.
nasha_components_partition_zfs_options_s: Highly-secured profile: Your file transfers get increased stability, but lower performance.
Non-secured profile: Very high performance, but also very high-risk because the ZFS ignores synchronous transfer requests. (DB, NFS, etc.)
Administrators should only use this option if they clearly understand the risks.
Secured profile: A combination of high stability and performance. Files are written first, then all elements are cleaned to ensure data stability.
